name: abrasive blasting, alumina, carbon steel substrate | abrasive blasting, alumina, carbon steel substrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30254/documentation

This activity provides the service of 1 square metre of abrasive blasting. The abrasive blasting is a process which uses compressed air to carry an abrasive agent towards the surface of the workpiece. This dataset uses alumina powder as abrasive agent. When the abrasive agent hits the surface, the dirt, the rust, and particles of the base metal gets removed. This process is modelled for a machine with a  working volume of 591x815x560 [mm]. The machine is operated manually. This dataset represent a GLO average because it is a well-established technique in the industry;The dataset includes the amount of substrate lost due to the abrasive action of the operation. The amount is expressed via the exchange of "steel, low-alloyed". The dataset doesn't include the workpiece, and doesn't include the construction and maintenance of the abrasive blasting machine.;Considering the specificity of the activity, this activity should be used only for the preparation of the workpieces for thermal spray coating.

The activity is a service and it starts with the workpiece placed in the abrasive blasting machine.The activity referes to the amount of time the workpiece is treated, without considering any impact realated to the other production steps of the workpiece.The carbon steel substrate is not included in the activity exchanges. 

The activity is a service and it ends with the workpiece at the exit of the abrasive blasting machine.
category: C:Manufacturing/25:Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment/259:Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activit/2592:Treatment and coating of metals; machining

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data were taken from a pilot-scale plant.The data collection was performed in 2022.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data are based on estimations and do not have a specific geographical origin. They are assumed to be representative of this geography.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The machine is manually operated, and it provides a working volume of 591x815x560 [mm]. The abrasive considered for this activity is alumina powder. Considering the specificity of the activity, this activity should be used only for the preparation of the workpieces for thermal spray coating.;The machine uses compressed air with a gauge pressure of 550 kPa. This dataset is considered to be valid for a carbon steel substrate.;The alumina is considered to be reused. The calculation is based on the condition of the pilot plant: 100g of alumina reused for 100 50x20mm specimens.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The values in the dataset were linearly extrapolated from the measurements performed on site.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The sampling of the data was performed on a speciment with dimension 50x20 [mm]. The time span of the blasting during the data collection was of 25 seconds. The results were scaled for the development of the dataset.

exchanges.description: The exchange referes to 1 hour of abrasive blasting.
